text.p: TORONTO, Aug 12 Reuter) - The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Dion rips Bouchard's tactics: Intergovernmental Affairs Minister challenges Quebec Premier to explain secession plan
-Mayors reassured taxes won't rise: But Ontario won't revive subsidies
-Teachers buying own class supplies: Budgets sometimes fail to cover pencils, erasers, books, survey finds
-China fights Tibet on cultural battlefield: Government has changed policy to target Buddhism, observer says
-Landing remains air safety's weak link: Despite widespread investment in sophisticated instruments, nearly 50 percent of fatal crashes take place in the last few minutes of flight.

-U.S. shoe giant heads north: Kansas's Payless ShoeSource plans to try Canada on for size with five Toronto-area stores -CGI Group buys Teleglobe unit for $140-million: Acquires U.S. insurance systems firm
-Trail goes cold for RCMP in Bre-X investigation: Officers so far unable to question key geologist Felderhof
-Family aims to reclaim American Sensors: Elliott-owned firm bids for company
-Loewen deals Arbor stake to rival Service Corp.
-C$ takes summer dive: Bank of Canada and markets continue their game of chicken as C$ nears 30-month low as speculation continues that the bank will raise rates soon
